Key Match Events: Sri Lanka's Kusal Perera and Kusal Mendis scored four and 11 respectively, dismissed by David Willey.
Pathum Nissanka and Sadeera Samarawickrama scored half-centuries, steering Sri Lanka to victory with eight wickets and 146 balls remaining.
Pre-Game Insights: England picked a team without any players younger than 30, aiming to protect those players who might have another World Cup in them from further scarring.
Post-Match Reflections: England lost all 10 wickets for 111 runs, with several dismissals described as'really putting the dismal into dismissal'.
Jos Buttler, excellently caught behind by Kusal Mendis off the outside edge, is averaging 19 and has scored only 10 more runs in the tournament than Mark Wood, England's No 11.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England collapsed from 45 without loss to 85 for five and onwards, downwards from there.
This is the first time in ODIs, and the first time in any format for more than a century, England picked a team without any players younger than 30.
